0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Primary hypercholesterolemia: powder, 5-30 g ORALLY (mixed with liquid) once daily or in divided doses
  • Primary hypercholesterolemia: TAB, initially 2 g ORALLY once or twice daily; maintenance, 2-16 g ORALLY once daily or in divided doses

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Primary hypercholesterolemia
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Familial hypercholesterolemia
  • Generalized atherosclerosis

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• may reduce absorption of fat-soluble vitamins (A, D, E, K)
  • increased bleeding (due to hypoprothrombinemia, vitamin K deficiency)
  • may worsen pre-existing constipation

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Colestipol: Micromedex: Milk effects are possible.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Colestipol hydrochloride, a lipid lowering agent, binds bile acids forming a complex that is then excreted in the feces. This action also results in partial removal of bile acids from the enterohepatic circulation which prevents its reabsorption.

3.title: Excretion
3.mono:
• Fecal: as a complex bound with bile acids
  • Renal: less than 0.17%

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    other drugs should be taken at least 1 h before or 4 h after oral administration
  • Oral
    • (suspension) mix powder with 3 oz or more of liquid, soup, cereal or pulpy fruits such as crushed pineapple, pears and peaches
    • (suspension) may be mixed with carbonated beverages and slowly stirred; however may be associated with gastrointestinal complaints
    • (suspension) stir the mixture until completely mixed
    • (suspension) rinse the glass with small amount of additional beverage to ensure the entire dose is taken
    • (suspension) do not take in dry form as it may cause esopagheal distress
    • (tablet) take 1 tablet at a time and promptly swallow whole
    • (tablet) do not crush, cut, or chew

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• lipid panel
  • signs and symptoms of vitamin A, D, E, or K deficiencies

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause abdominal distension or pain, constipation, aggravation of hemorrhoids, nausea, or vomiting.
  • Patients with pre-existing constipation should report exacerbation.
  • Advise patients to report signs/symptoms of bleeding.
  • Instruct patient that other drugs should be taken at least 1 h before or 4 h after oral administration of colestipol hydrochloride.
